column7: but having no where to go because of my parents forcing me to cut off ties from all my friends and isolating me
column8: because of that I’m planning on leaving without anything I have because it’s unrealistic I could take anything with me
column10: I just want to get out and start my life
column11: All the fees will go to -Homing and building my life again -legal fees
column15: which are all controlled by my parents -Food/clothing -Medical costs
column17: I was supposed to have a jaw surgery in a few months but I don’t think I can last that long -Etc  Every dollar helps.  Listen
column18: if y'all gonna be islamaphobic on Anon/ private message

column24: Which I practice out of free will

column1: glassesanddreads 152975050638 "2016-11-10 01:32:01 GMT" http://glassesanddreads.co.vu/post/152975050638/click-here-to-support-viris-continuing-recovery "blood-and-violets:Hello y'all. I’m Viridian
column2: a lower-class white intersex trans woman living in Portland
column3: Oregon. In late September I held a fundraiser for my recovery from top surgery which was scheduled for the middle of October. I had met my goal and had planned out very carefully every aspect of how I would spend the money
column4: both leading up to the surgery with preparations and throughout my recovery by covering food and rent. I have been unemployed and wasn’t able to pursue employment with an impending surgery involving a recovery period of several weeks. The money from the fundraiser is basically my lifeline until I’m well and able to go find work. Unfortunately
column5: I caught a virulent strain of strep in late September and after I took antibiotics I developed an incredibly painful condition where a lymph node on my neck got so enlarged that it began pressing on my inner ear and causing massive pain in my jaw
column6: giving me a fever and night sweats. My tonsils also remained irritated and painful throughout this process making it difficult to swallow and eat. I went to the ER
column8: saw 4 different doctors and finally saw an ENT specialist. I had over 15 blood tests for infectious diseases (all negative) and an incredibly painful biopsy of my lymph node. My primary care doctor forced me to postpone my surgery. The ENT was well convinced that I had Hodgkins Lymphoma and also forced me to postpone my top surgery until he found the root cause of my condition through the results of the biopsy
column9: which turned out to be inconclusive (which is still terrifying to me because I don’t know what’s wrong). At this point in time I’m being told it’s unlikely I have cancer
column10: which is immensely relieving. So because of this horrible mess
column11: my surgery was set back by 2 weeks. I decided to just go for it despite my health issues. In the mean time I tried to live as frugally as possible in order to try to save as much of my recovery fund as I could
column12: but this illness set me back so far that my planning has faltered and I need to ask for help again. My surgery happened on November 1st. I’m currently on my feet and moving but am still in incredible pain and managing it with strong medications. I won’t be able to work for at least another couple of weeks and I’m about to become completely broke. If anyone can help me with just a little bit more to carry me through to finding gainful employment I will immensely grateful!Thank you for your time and patience reading this. Please share and boost it! " False link

column2: I volunteer at a school for high-support children on the ASD (autism) spectrum. Our school is a new
column4: Muslim and Christian Israeli and Arabic children. Since our school is brand new we have yet to get a hold on important communication devices such as iPads
column6: and GoTalk devices for our non-verbal children. We also need teaching
column9: occupational therapy and sesnory stimulation devices. Global Giving Foundation has set up a donation project where we can possibly raise some money to buy these necessities.  We have a dream and goal to help every single one of our students independently communicate and care for themselves in the best and most suitable ways for them.  Please
column11: and\or reblog this post so it could reach people who can help us will see it. Your donations could make a big difference in a child’s life! " False link

glassesanddreads 145515060283 "2016-06-06 17:36:19 GMT" http://glassesanddreads.co.vu/post/145515060283/star-wars-john-boyega-takes-lead-in-pacific "entertainingtheidea:  Legendary Pictures has set Star Wars: The Force Awakens star John Boyega for the lead role for the second installment of its Pacific Rim franchise. Steven S. DeKnight is directing the film
column2: which will begin production in the fourth quarter of this year
column3: based on the world created by Guillermo del Toro and Travis Beacham. Boyega will play the son of the character played by Idris Elba in the del Toro-directed original film. Universal will release the film worldwide
column4: everywhere but China. The 2013 original grossed $411 million. Thomas Tull
column7: and del Toro will produce the action adventure film along with Boyega and Femi Oguns under their Upper Room Productions shingle. Cale Boyter is executive producer.  The picture is a beach head project for Legendary
column9: who became Tull’s vice chairman of Worldwide Production after Jashni exited to start his own venture. The principals have confirmed to Deadline they found their man in Boyega. “It is undeniable that with all his talent and natural charm
column10: John stands out amongst today’s generation of young leading men
column11: ” said Parent. Said del Toro: “I am very proud and happy to welcome John into a fantastic sandbox. The Pacific Rim universe will be reinforced with him as a leading man as it continues to be a multicultural
column12: multi-layered world. ‘The World saving the world’ was our goal and I couldn’t think of a better man for the job.”      " False link

column11: although it is known that the writer is female. " False link
